37.english: So Hushai David's friend came into the city; and Absalom was at the point of coming into Jerusalem. {S}

1.hebrew: וְדָוִד, עָבַר מְעַט מֵהָרֹאשׁ, וְהִנֵּה צִיבָא נַעַר מְפִיבֹשֶׁת, לִקְרָאתוֹ; וְצֶמֶד חֲמֹרִים חֲבֻשִׁים, וַעֲלֵיהֶם מָאתַיִם לֶחֶם וּמֵאָה צִמּוּקִים וּמֵאָה קַיִץ--וְנֵבֶל יָיִן.
1.english: And when David was a little past the top, behold, Ziba the servant of Mephibosheth met him, with a couple of asses saddled, and upon them two hundred loaves of bread, and a hundred clusters of raisins, and a hundred of summer fruits, and a bottle of wine.

2.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר הַמֶּלֶךְ אֶל-צִיבָא, מָה-אֵלֶּה לָּךְ; וַיֹּאמֶר צִיבָא הַחֲמוֹרִים לְבֵית-הַמֶּלֶךְ לִרְכֹּב, ולהלחם (וְהַלֶּחֶם) וְהַקַּיִץ לֶאֱכוֹל הַנְּעָרִים, וְהַיַּיִן, לִשְׁתּוֹת הַיָּעֵף בַּמִּדְבָּר.
2.english: And the king said unto Ziba: 'What meanest thou by these?' And Ziba said: 'The asses are for the king's household to ride on; and the bread and summer fruit for the young men to eat; and the wine, that such as are faint in the wilderness may drink.'

3.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר הַמֶּלֶךְ, וְאַיֵּה בֶּן-אֲדֹנֶיךָ; וַיֹּאמֶר צִיבָא אֶל-הַמֶּלֶךְ, הִנֵּה יוֹשֵׁב בִּירוּשָׁלִַם--כִּי אָמַר, הַיּוֹם יָשִׁיבוּ לִי בֵּית יִשְׂרָאֵל אֵת מַמְלְכוּת אָבִי.
3.english: And the king said: 'And where is thy master's son?' And Ziba said unto the king: 'Behold, he abideth at Jerusalem; for he said: To-day will the house of Israel restore me the kingdom of my father.'

4.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר הַמֶּלֶךְ, לְצִבָא, הִנֵּה לְךָ, כֹּל אֲשֶׁר לִמְפִיבֹשֶׁת; וַיֹּאמֶר צִיבָא הִשְׁתַּחֲוֵיתִי, אֶמְצָא-חֵן בְּעֵינֶיךָ אֲדֹנִי הַמֶּלֶךְ.
4.english: Then said the king to Ziba: 'Behold, thine is all that pertaineth unto Mephibosheth.' And Ziba said: 'I prostrate myself; let me find favour in thy sight, my lord, O king.'

5.hebrew: וּבָא הַמֶּלֶךְ דָּוִד, עַד-בַּחוּרִים; וְהִנֵּה מִשָּׁם אִישׁ יוֹצֵא מִמִּשְׁפַּחַת בֵּית-שָׁאוּל, וּשְׁמוֹ שִׁמְעִי בֶן-גֵּרָא, יֹצֵא יָצוֹא, וּמְקַלֵּל.
5.english: And when king David came to Bahurim, behold, there came out thence a man of the family of the house of Saul, whose name was Shimei, the son of Gera; he came out, and kept on cursing as he came.

6.hebrew: וַיְסַקֵּל בָּאֲבָנִים אֶת-דָּוִד, וְאֶת-כָּל-עַבְדֵי הַמֶּלֶךְ דָּוִד; וְכָל-הָעָם, וְכָל-הַגִּבֹּרִים, מִימִינוֹ, וּמִשְּׂמֹאלוֹ.
6.english: And he cast stones at David, and at all the servants of king David; and all the people and all the mighty men were on his right hand and on his left.

7.hebrew: וְכֹה-אָמַר שִׁמְעִי, בְּקַלְלוֹ; צֵא צֵא אִישׁ הַדָּמִים, וְאִישׁ הַבְּלִיָּעַל.
7.english: And thus said Shimei when he cursed: 'Begone, begone, thou man of blood, and base fellow;

8.hebrew: הֵשִׁיב עָלֶיךָ יְהוָה כֹּל דְּמֵי בֵית-שָׁאוּל, אֲשֶׁר מָלַכְתָּ תַּחְתָּו, וַיִּתֵּן יְהוָה אֶת-הַמְּלוּכָה, בְּיַד אַבְשָׁלוֹם בְּנֶךָ; וְהִנְּךָ, בְּרָעָתֶךָ, כִּי אִישׁ דָּמִים, אָתָּה.
8.english: the LORD hath returned upon thee all the blood of the house of Saul, in whose stead thou hast reigned; and the LORD hath delivered the kingdom into the hand of Absalom thy son; and, behold, thou art taken in thine own mischief, because thou art a man of blood.'

9.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר אֲבִישַׁי בֶּן-צְרוּיָה, אֶל-הַמֶּלֶךְ, לָמָּה יְקַלֵּל הַכֶּלֶב הַמֵּת הַזֶּה, אֶת-אֲדֹנִי הַמֶּלֶךְ; אֶעְבְּרָה-נָּא, וְאָסִירָה אֶת-רֹאשׁוֹ.  {ס}
9.english: Then said Abishai the son of Zeruiah unto the king: 'Why should this dead dog curse my lord the king? let me go over, I pray thee, and take off his head.' {S}

10.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר הַמֶּלֶךְ, מַה-לִּי וְלָכֶם בְּנֵי צְרֻיָה; כי (כֹּה) יְקַלֵּל, וכי (כִּי) יְהוָה אָמַר לוֹ קַלֵּל אֶת-דָּוִד, וּמִי יֹאמַר, מַדּוּעַ עָשִׂיתָה כֵּן.  {ס}
10.english: And the king said: 'What have I to do with you, ye sons of Zeruiah? So let him curse, because the LORD hath said unto him: Curse David; who then shall say: Wherefore hast thou done so?' {S}

11.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר דָּוִד אֶל-אֲבִישַׁי וְאֶל-כָּל-עֲבָדָיו, הִנֵּה בְנִי אֲשֶׁר-יָצָא מִמֵּעַי מְבַקֵּשׁ אֶת-נַפְשִׁי; וְאַף כִּי-עַתָּה בֶּן-הַיְמִינִי, הַנִּחוּ לוֹ וִיקַלֵּל--כִּי אָמַר-לוֹ, יְהוָה.
11.english: And David said to Abishai, and to all his servants: 'Behold, my son, who came forth of my body, seeketh my life; how much more this Benjamite now? let him alone, and let him curse; for the LORD hath bidden him.

12.hebrew: אוּלַי יִרְאֶה יְהוָה, בעוני (בְּעֵינִי); וְהֵשִׁיב יְהוָה לִי טוֹבָה, תַּחַת קִלְלָתוֹ הַיּוֹם הַזֶּה.
12.english: It may be that the LORD will look on mine eye, and that the LORD will requite me good for his cursing of me this day.'

13.hebrew: וַיֵּלֶךְ דָּוִד וַאֲנָשָׁיו, בַּדָּרֶךְ;  {ס}  וְשִׁמְעִי הֹלֵךְ בְּצֵלַע הָהָר לְעֻמָּתוֹ, הָלוֹךְ וַיְקַלֵּל, וַיְסַקֵּל בָּאֲבָנִים לְעֻמָּתוֹ, וְעִפַּר בֶּעָפָר.  {פ}
13.english: So David and his men went by the way; {S} and Shimei went along on the hill-side over against him, and cursed as he went, and threw stones at him, and cast dust. {P}

14.hebrew: וַיָּבֹא הַמֶּלֶךְ וְכָל-הָעָם אֲשֶׁר-אִתּוֹ, עֲיֵפִים; וַיִּנָּפֵשׁ, שָׁם.
14.english: And the king, and all the people that were with him, came weary; and he refreshed himself there.

15.hebrew: וְאַבְשָׁלוֹם, וְכָל-הָעָם אִישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵל, בָּאוּ, יְרוּשָׁלִָם; וַאֲחִיתֹפֶל, אִתּוֹ.
15.english: And Absalom, and all the people, the men of Israel, came to Jerusalem, and Ahithophel with him.

16.hebrew: וַיְהִי, כַּאֲשֶׁר-בָּא חוּשַׁי הָאַרְכִּי רֵעֶה דָוִד--אֶל-אַבְשָׁלוֹם; וַיֹּאמֶר חוּשַׁי אֶל-אַבְשָׁלוֹם, יְחִי הַמֶּלֶךְ יְחִי הַמֶּלֶךְ.
16.english: And it came to pass, when Hushai the Archite, David's friend, was come unto Absalom, that Hushai said unto Absalom: 'Long live the king, long live the king.'

17.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר אַבְשָׁלוֹם אֶל-חוּשַׁי, זֶה חַסְדְּךָ אֶת-רֵעֶךָ; לָמָּה לֹא-הָלַכְתָּ, אֶת-רֵעֶךָ.
17.english: And Absalom said to Hushai: 'Is this thy kindness to thy friend? why wentest thou not with thy friend?'

18.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר חוּשַׁי, אֶל-אַבְשָׁלֹם, לֹא, כִּי אֲשֶׁר בָּחַר יְהוָה וְהָעָם הַזֶּה וְכָל-אִישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵל--לא (לוֹ) אֶהְיֶה, וְאִתּוֹ אֵשֵׁב.
18.english: And Hushai said unto Absalom: 'Nay; but whom the LORD, and this people, and all the men of Israel have chosen, his will I be, and with him will I abide.

19.hebrew: וְהַשֵּׁנִית, לְמִי אֲנִי אֶעֱבֹד--הֲלוֹא, לִפְנֵי בְנוֹ:  כַּאֲשֶׁר עָבַדְתִּי לִפְנֵי אָבִיךָ, כֵּן אֶהְיֶה לִפָנֶיךָ.  {פ}
19.english: And again, whom should I serve? should I not serve in the presence of his son? as I have served in thy father's presence, so will I be in thy presence.' {P}

20.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר אַבְשָׁלוֹם, אֶל-אֲחִיתֹפֶל:  הָבוּ לָכֶם עֵצָה, מַה-נַּעֲשֶׂה.
20.english: Then said Absalom to Ahithophel: 'Give your counsel what we shall do.'

21.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר אֲחִיתֹפֶל, אֶל-אַבְשָׁלֹם, בּוֹא אֶל-פִּלַגְשֵׁי אָבִיךָ, אֲשֶׁר הִנִּיחַ לִשְׁמוֹר הַבָּיִת; וְשָׁמַע כָּל-יִשְׂרָאֵל, כִּי-נִבְאַשְׁתָּ אֶת-אָבִיךָ, וְחָזְקוּ, יְדֵי כָּל-אֲשֶׁר אִתָּךְ.
21.english: And Ahithophel said unto Absalom: 'Go in unto thy father's concubines, that he hath left to keep the house; and all Israel will hear that thou art abhorred of thy father; then will the hands of all that are with thee be strong.'

22.hebrew: וַיַּטּוּ לְאַבְשָׁלוֹם הָאֹהֶל, עַל-הַגָּג; וַיָּבֹא אַבְשָׁלוֹם אֶל-פִּלַגְשֵׁי אָבִיו, לְעֵינֵי כָּל-יִשְׂרָאֵל.
22.english: So they spread Absalom a tent upon the top of the house; and Absalom went in unto his father's concubines in the sight of all Israel.--

23.hebrew: וַעֲצַת אֲחִיתֹפֶל, אֲשֶׁר יָעַץ בַּיָּמִים הָהֵם, כַּאֲשֶׁר יִשְׁאַל-    (אִישׁ), בִּדְבַר הָאֱלֹהִים; כֵּן כָּל-עֲצַת אֲחִיתֹפֶל, גַּם-לְדָוִד גַּם לְאַבְשָׁלֹם.  {ס}
23.english: Now the counsel of Ahithophel, which he counselled in those days, was as if a man inquired of the word of God; so was all the counsel of Ahithophel both with David and with Absalom. {S}

1.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר אֲחִיתֹפֶל, אֶל-אַבְשָׁלוֹם:  אֶבְחֲרָה נָּא, שְׁנֵים-עָשָׂר אֶלֶף אִישׁ, וְאָקוּמָה וְאֶרְדְּפָה אַחֲרֵי-דָוִד, הַלָּיְלָה.
1.english: Moreover Ahithophel said unto Absalom: 'Let me now choose out twelve thousand men, and I will arise and pursue after David this night;

2.hebrew: וְאָבוֹא עָלָיו, וְהוּא יָגֵעַ וּרְפֵה יָדַיִם, וְהַחֲרַדְתִּי אֹתוֹ, וְנָס כָּל-הָעָם אֲשֶׁר-אִתּוֹ; וְהִכֵּיתִי אֶת-הַמֶּלֶךְ, לְבַדּוֹ.
2.english: and I will come upon him while he is weary and weak-handed, and will make him afraid; and all the people that are with him shall flee; and I will smite the king only;

3.hebrew: וְאָשִׁיבָה כָל-הָעָם, אֵלֶיךָ:  כְּשׁוּב הַכֹּל--הָאִישׁ אֲשֶׁר אַתָּה מְבַקֵּשׁ, כָּל-הָעָם יִהְיֶה שָׁלוֹם.
3.english: and I will bring back all the people unto thee; when all shall have returned, [save] the man whom thou seekest, all the people will be in peace.'

4.hebrew: וַיִּישַׁר הַדָּבָר, בְּעֵינֵי אַבְשָׁלֹם, וּבְעֵינֵי, כָּל-זִקְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל.  {ס}
4.english: And the saying pleased Absalom well, and all the elders of Israel. {S}

5.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר, אַבְשָׁלוֹם, קְרָא נָא, גַּם לְחוּשַׁי הָאַרְכִּי; וְנִשְׁמְעָה מַה-בְּפִיו, גַּם-הוּא.
5.english: Then said Absalom: 'Call now Hushai the Archite also, and let us hear likewise what he saith.'

6.hebrew: וַיָּבֹא חוּשַׁי, אֶל-אַבְשָׁלוֹם, וַיֹּאמֶר אַבְשָׁלוֹם אֵלָיו לֵאמֹר כַּדָּבָר הַזֶּה דִּבֶּר אֲחִיתֹפֶל, הֲנַעֲשֶׂה אֶת-דְּבָרוֹ; אִם-אַיִן, אַתָּה דַבֵּר.  {ס}
6.english: And when Hushai was come to Absalom, Absalom spoke unto him, saying: 'Ahithophel hath spoken after this manner; shall we do after his saying? if not, speak thou.' {S}

7.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר חוּשַׁי, אֶל-אַבְשָׁלוֹם:  לֹא-טוֹבָה הָעֵצָה אֲשֶׁר-יָעַץ אֲחִיתֹפֶל, בַּפַּעַם הַזֹּאת.
7.english: And Hushai said unto Absalom: 'The counsel that Ahithophel hath given this time is not good.'

8.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר חוּשַׁי, אַתָּה יָדַעְתָּ אֶת-אָבִיךָ וְאֶת-אֲנָשָׁיו כִּי גִבֹּרִים הֵמָּה וּמָרֵי נֶפֶשׁ הֵמָּה, כְּדֹב שַׁכּוּל, בַּשָּׂדֶה; וְאָבִיךָ אִישׁ מִלְחָמָה, וְלֹא יָלִין אֶת-הָעָם.
8.english: Hushai said moreover: 'Thou knowest thy father and his men, that they are mighty men, and they are embittered in their minds, as a bear robbed of her whelps in the field; and thy father is a man of war, and will not lodge with the people.

9.hebrew: הִנֵּה עַתָּה הוּא-נֶחְבָּא בְּאַחַת הַפְּחָתִים, אוֹ בְּאַחַד הַמְּקוֹמֹת; וְהָיָה, כִּנְפֹל בָּהֶם בַּתְּחִלָּה, וְשָׁמַע הַשֹּׁמֵעַ וְאָמַר, הָיְתָה מַגֵּפָה בָּעָם אֲשֶׁר אַחֲרֵי אַבְשָׁלֹם.
9.english: Behold, he is hid now in some pit, or in some place; and it will come to pass, when they fall upon them at the first, and whosoever heareth it shall say: There is a slaughter among the people that follow Absalom;

10.hebrew: וְהוּא גַם-בֶּן-חַיִל, אֲשֶׁר לִבּוֹ כְּלֵב הָאַרְיֵה--הִמֵּס יִמָּס:  כִּי-יֹדֵעַ כָּל-יִשְׂרָאֵל כִּי-גִבּוֹר אָבִיךָ, וּבְנֵי-חַיִל אֲשֶׁר אִתּוֹ.
10.english: then even he that is valiant, whose heart is as the heart of a lion, will utterly melt; for all Israel knoweth that thy father is a mighty man, and they that are with him are valiant men.

11.hebrew: כִּי יָעַצְתִּי, הֵאָסֹף יֵאָסֵף עָלֶיךָ כָל-יִשְׂרָאֵל מִדָּן וְעַד-בְּאֵר שֶׁבַע, כַּחוֹל אֲשֶׁר-עַל-הַיָּם, לָרֹב; וּפָנֶיךָ הֹלְכִים, בַּקְרָב.
11.english: But I counsel that all Israel be gathered together unto thee, from Dan even to Beer-sheba, as the sand that is by the sea for multitude; and that thou go to battle in thine own person.

12.hebrew: וּבָאנוּ אֵלָיו, באחת (בְּאַחַד) הַמְּקוֹמֹת אֲשֶׁר נִמְצָא שָׁם, וְנַחְנוּ עָלָיו, כַּאֲשֶׁר יִפֹּל הַטַּל עַל-הָאֲדָמָה; וְלֹא-נוֹתַר בּוֹ וּבְכָל-הָאֲנָשִׁים אֲשֶׁר-אִתּוֹ, גַּם-אֶחָד.
12.english: So shall we come upon him in some place where he shall be found, and we will light upon him as the dew falleth on the ground; and of him and of all the men that are with him we will not leave so much as one.

13.hebrew: וְאִם-אֶל-עִיר, יֵאָסֵף--וְהִשִּׂיאוּ כָל-יִשְׂרָאֵל אֶל-הָעִיר הַהִיא, חֲבָלִים; וְסָחַבְנוּ אֹתוֹ עַד-הַנַּחַל, עַד אֲשֶׁר-לֹא-נִמְצָא שָׁם גַּם-צְרוֹר.  {פ}
13.english: Moreover, if he withdraw himself into a city, then shall all Israel bring up ropes to that city, and we will draw it into the valley until there be not one small stone found there.' {P}

14.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר אַבְשָׁלוֹם, וְכָל-אִישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵל, טוֹבָה עֲצַת חוּשַׁי הָאַרְכִּי, מֵעֲצַת אֲחִיתֹפֶל;  {ס}  וַיהוָה צִוָּה, לְהָפֵר אֶת-עֲצַת אֲחִיתֹפֶל הַטּוֹבָה, לְבַעֲבוּר הָבִיא יְהוָה אֶל-אַבְשָׁלוֹם, אֶת-הָרָעָה.  {ס}
14.english: And Absalom and all the men of Israel said: 'The counsel of Hushai the Archite is better than the counsel of Ahithophel.' {S} --For the LORD had ordained to defeat the good counsel of Ahithophel, to the intent that the LORD might bring evil upon Absalom. {S}

15.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר חוּשַׁי, אֶל-צָדוֹק וְאֶל-אֶבְיָתָר הַכֹּהֲנִים, כָּזֹאת וְכָזֹאת יָעַץ אֲחִיתֹפֶל אֶת-אַבְשָׁלֹם, וְאֵת זִקְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל; וְכָזֹאת וְכָזֹאת, יָעַצְתִּי אָנִי.
15.english: Then said Hushai unto Zadok and to Abiathar the priests: 'Thus and thus did Ahithophel counsel Absalom and the elders of Israel; and thus and thus have I counselled.

16.hebrew: וְעַתָּה שִׁלְחוּ מְהֵרָה וְהַגִּידוּ לְדָוִד לֵאמֹר, אַל-תָּלֶן הַלַּיְלָה בְּעַרְבוֹת הַמִּדְבָּר, וְגַם, עָבוֹר תַּעֲבוֹר--פֶּן יְבֻלַּע לַמֶּלֶךְ, וּלְכָל-הָעָם אֲשֶׁר אִתּוֹ.
16.english: Now therefore send quickly, and tell David, saying: Lodge not this night in the plains of the wilderness, but in any wise pass over; lest the king be swallowed up, and all the people that are with him.'

17.hebrew: וִיהוֹנָתָן וַאֲחִימַעַץ עֹמְדִים בְּעֵין-רֹגֵל, וְהָלְכָה הַשִּׁפְחָה וְהִגִּידָה לָהֶם, וְהֵם יֵלְכוּ, וְהִגִּידוּ לַמֶּלֶךְ דָּוִד:  כִּי לֹא יוּכְלוּ לְהֵרָאוֹת, לָבוֹא הָעִירָה.
17.english: Now Jonathan and Ahimaaz stayed by En-rogel; and a maid-servant used to go and tell them; and they went and told king David; for they might not be seen to come into the city.

18.hebrew: וַיַּרְא אֹתָם נַעַר, וַיַּגֵּד לְאַבְשָׁלֹם; וַיֵּלְכוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם מְהֵרָה וַיָּבֹאוּ אֶל-בֵּית-אִישׁ בְּבַחוּרִים, וְלוֹ בְאֵר בַּחֲצֵרוֹ--וַיֵּרְדוּ שָׁם.
18.english: But a lad saw them, and told Absalom; and they went both of them away quickly, and came to the house of a man in Bahurim, who had a well in his court; and they went down thither.

19.hebrew: וַתִּקַּח הָאִשָּׁה, וַתִּפְרֹשׂ אֶת-הַמָּסָךְ עַל-פְּנֵי הַבְּאֵר, וַתִּשְׁטַח עָלָיו, הָרִפוֹת; וְלֹא נוֹדַע, דָּבָר.
19.english: And the woman took and spread the covering over the well's mouth, and strewed groats thereon; and nothing was known.

20.hebrew: וַיָּבֹאוּ עַבְדֵי אַבְשָׁלוֹם אֶל-הָאִשָּׁה הַבַּיְתָה, וַיֹּאמְרוּ אַיֵּה אֲחִימַעַץ וִיהוֹנָתָן, וַתֹּאמֶר לָהֶם הָאִשָּׁה, עָבְרוּ מִיכַל הַמָּיִם; וַיְבַקְשׁוּ וְלֹא מָצָאוּ, וַיָּשֻׁבוּ יְרוּשָׁלִָם.  {ס}
20.english: And Absalom's servants came to the woman to the house; and they said: 'Where are Ahimaaz and Jonathan?' And the woman said unto them: 'They are gone over the brook of water.' And when they had sought and could not find them, they returned to Jerusalem. {S}

21.hebrew: וַיְהִי אַחֲרֵי לֶכְתָּם, וַיַּעֲלוּ מֵהַבְּאֵר, וַיֵּלְכוּ, וַיַּגִּדוּ לַמֶּלֶךְ דָּוִד; וַיֹּאמְרוּ אֶל-דָּוִד, קוּמוּ וְעִבְרוּ מְהֵרָה אֶת-הַמַּיִם--כִּי-כָכָה יָעַץ עֲלֵיכֶם, אֲחִיתֹפֶל.
21.english: And it came to pass, after they were departed, that they came up out of the well, and went and told king David; and they said unto David: 'Arise ye, and pass quickly over the water; for thus hath Ahithophel counselled against you.'

22.hebrew: וַיָּקָם דָּוִד, וְכָל-הָעָם אֲשֶׁר אִתּוֹ, וַיַּעַבְרוּ, אֶת-הַיַּרְדֵּן:  עַד-אוֹר הַבֹּקֶר, עַד-אַחַד לֹא נֶעְדָּר, אֲשֶׁר לֹא-עָבַר, אֶת-הַיַּרְדֵּן.
22.english: Then David arose, and all the people that were with him, and they passed over the Jordan; by the morning light there lacked not one of them that was not gone over the Jordan.

23.hebrew: וַאֲחִיתֹפֶל רָאָה, כִּי לֹא נֶעֶשְׂתָה עֲצָתוֹ, וַיַּחֲבֹשׁ אֶת-הַחֲמוֹר וַיָּקָם וַיֵּלֶךְ אֶל-בֵּיתוֹ אֶל-עִירוֹ, וַיְצַו אֶל-בֵּיתוֹ וַיֵּחָנַק; וַיָּמָת, וַיִּקָּבֵר בְּקֶבֶר אָבִיו.  {ס}
23.english: And when Ahithophel saw that his counsel was not followed, he saddled his ass, and arose, and got him home, unto his city, and set his house in order, and strangled himself; and he died, and was buried in the sepulchre of his father. {S}

24.hebrew: וְדָוִד, בָּא מַחֲנָיְמָה; וְאַבְשָׁלֹם, עָבַר אֶת-הַיַּרְדֵּן--הוּא, וְכָל-אִישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵל עִמּוֹ.
24.english: When David was come to Mahanaim, Absalom passed over the Jordan, he and all the men of Israel with him.

25.hebrew: וְאֶת-עֲמָשָׂא, שָׂם אַבְשָׁלֹם תַּחַת יוֹאָב--עַל-הַצָּבָא; וַעֲמָשָׂא בֶן-אִישׁ, וּשְׁמוֹ יִתְרָא הַיִּשְׂרְאֵלִי, אֲשֶׁר-בָּא אֶל-אֲבִיגַל בַּת-נָחָשׁ, אֲחוֹת צְרוּיָה אֵם יוֹאָב.
25.english: And Absalom had set Amasa over the host instead of Joab. Now Amasa was the son of a man, whose name was Ithra the Jesraelite, that went in to Abigal the daughter of Nahash, sister to Zeruiah Joab's mother.

26.english: And Israel and Absalom pitched in the land of Gilead. {S}

27.hebrew: וַיְהִי, כְּבוֹא דָוִד מַחֲנָיְמָה; וְשֹׁבִי בֶן-נָחָשׁ מֵרַבַּת בְּנֵי-עַמּוֹן, וּמָכִיר בֶּן-עַמִּיאֵל מִלֹּא דְבָר, וּבַרְזִלַּי הַגִּלְעָדִי, מֵרֹגְלִים.
27.english: And it came to pass, when David was come to Mahanaim, that Shobi the son of Nahash of Rabbah of the children of Ammon, and Machir the son of Ammiel of Lo-debar, and Barzillai the Gileadite of Rogelim,

28.hebrew: מִשְׁכָּב וְסַפּוֹת וּכְלִי יוֹצֵר, וְחִטִּים וּשְׂעֹרִים וְקֶמַח וְקָלִי, וּפוֹל וַעֲדָשִׁים, וְקָלִי.
28.english: brought beds, and basins, and earthen vessels, and wheat, and barley, and meal, and parched corn, and beans, and lentils, and parched pulse,

29.hebrew: וּדְבַשׁ וְחֶמְאָה, וְצֹאן וּשְׁפוֹת בָּקָר, הִגִּישׁוּ לְדָוִד וְלָעָם אֲשֶׁר-אִתּוֹ, לֶאֱכוֹל:  כִּי אָמְרוּ--הָעָם רָעֵב וְעָיֵף וְצָמֵא, בַּמִּדְבָּר.  {ס}
29.english: and honey, and curd, and sheep, and cheese of kine, for David, and for the people that were with him, to eat; for they said: 'The people is hungry, and faint, and thirsty, in the wilderness.' {S}

And the words of the men of Judah were fiercer than the words of the men of Israel. {S}

1.hebrew: וְשָׁם נִקְרָא אִישׁ בְּלִיַּעַל, וּשְׁמוֹ שֶׁבַע בֶּן-בִּכְרִי--אִישׁ יְמִינִי; וַיִּתְקַע בַּשֹּׁפָר, וַיֹּאמֶר אֵין-לָנוּ חֵלֶק בְּדָוִד וְלֹא נַחֲלָה-לָנוּ בְּבֶן-יִשַׁי--אִישׁ לְאֹהָלָיו, יִשְׂרָאֵל.
1.english: Now there happened to be there a base fellow, whose name was Sheba, the son of Bichri, a Benjamite; and he blew the horn, and said: 'We have no portion in David, neither have we inheritance in the son of Jesse; every man to his tents, O Israel.'

2.hebrew: וַיַּעַל כָּל-אִישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵל, מֵאַחֲרֵי דָוִד, אַחֲרֵי, שֶׁבַע בֶּן-בִּכְרִי; וְאִישׁ יְהוּדָה דָּבְקוּ בְמַלְכָּם, מִן-הַיַּרְדֵּן וְעַד-יְרוּשָׁלִָם.
2.english: So all the men of Israel went up from following David, and followed Sheba the son of Bichri; but the men of Judah did cleave unto their king, from the Jordan even to Jerusalem.

3.hebrew: וַיָּבֹא דָוִד אֶל-בֵּיתוֹ, יְרוּשָׁלִַם, וַיִּקַּח הַמֶּלֶךְ אֵת עֶשֶׂר-נָשִׁים פִּלַגְשִׁים אֲשֶׁר הִנִּיחַ לִשְׁמֹר הַבַּיִת וַיִּתְּנֵם בֵּית-מִשְׁמֶרֶת וַיְכַלְכְּלֵם, וַאֲלֵיהֶם לֹא-בָא; וַתִּהְיֶינָה צְרֻרוֹת עַד-יוֹם מֻתָן, אַלְמְנוּת חַיּוּת.  {ס}
3.english: And David came to his house at Jerusalem; and the king took the ten women his concubines, whom he had left to keep the house, and put them in ward, and provided them with sustenance, but went not in unto them. So they were shut up unto the day of their death, in widowhood, with their husband alive. {S}

4.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר הַמֶּלֶךְ אֶל-עֲמָשָׂא, הַזְעֶק-לִי אֶת-אִישׁ-יְהוּדָה שְׁלֹשֶׁת יָמִים; וְאַתָּה, פֹּה עֲמֹד.
4.english: Then said the king to Amasa: 'Call me the men of Judah together within three days, and be thou here present.'

5.hebrew: וַיֵּלֶךְ עֲמָשָׂא, לְהַזְעִיק אֶת-יְהוּדָה; וייחר (וַיּוֹחֶר), מִן-הַמּוֹעֵד אֲשֶׁר יְעָדוֹ.  {ס}
5.english: So Amasa went to call the men of Judah together; but he tarried longer than the set time which he had appointed him. {S}

6.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר דָּוִד, אֶל-אֲבִישַׁי, עַתָּה יֵרַע לָנוּ שֶׁבַע בֶּן-בִּכְרִי, מִן-אַבְשָׁלוֹם; אַתָּה קַח אֶת-עַבְדֵי אֲדֹנֶיךָ, וּרְדֹף אַחֲרָיו--פֶּן-מָצָא לוֹ עָרִים בְּצֻרוֹת, וְהִצִּיל עֵינֵנוּ.
6.english: And David said to Abishai: 'Now will Sheba the son of Bichri do us more harm than did Absalom; take thou thy lord's servants, and pursue after him, lest he get him fortified cities, and escape out of our sight.'

7.hebrew: וַיֵּצְאוּ אַחֲרָיו אַנְשֵׁי יוֹאָב, וְהַכְּרֵתִי וְהַפְּלֵתִי וְכָל-הַגִּבֹּרִים; וַיֵּצְאוּ, מִירוּשָׁלִַם, לִרְדֹּף, אַחֲרֵי שֶׁבַע בֶּן-בִּכְרִי.
7.english: And there went out after him Joab's men, and the Cherethites and the Pelethites, and all the mighty men; and they went out of Jerusalem, to pursue after Sheba the son of Bichri.

8.hebrew: הֵם, עִם-הָאֶבֶן הַגְּדוֹלָה אֲשֶׁר בְּגִבְעוֹן, וַעֲמָשָׂא, בָּא לִפְנֵיהֶם; וְיוֹאָב חָגוּר מִדּוֹ לְבֻשׁוֹ, וְעָלָו חֲגוֹר חֶרֶב מְצֻמֶּדֶת עַל-מָתְנָיו בְּתַעְרָהּ, וְהוּא יָצָא, וַתִּפֹּל.  {ס}
8.english: When they were at the great stone which is in Gibeon, Amasa came to meet them. And Joab was girded with his apparel of war that he had put on, and thereon was a girdle with a sword fastened upon his loins in the sheath thereof; and as he went forth it fell out. {S}

9.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר יוֹאָב לַעֲמָשָׂא, הֲשָׁלוֹם אַתָּה אָחִי; וַתֹּחֶז יַד-יְמִין יוֹאָב, בִּזְקַן עֲמָשָׂא--לִנְשָׁק-לוֹ.
9.english: And Joab said to Amasa: 'Is it well with thee, my brother?' And Joab took Amasa by the beard with his right hand to kiss him.

10.hebrew: וַעֲמָשָׂא לֹא-נִשְׁמַר בַּחֶרֶב אֲשֶׁר בְּיַד-יוֹאָב, וַיַּכֵּהוּ בָהּ אֶל-הַחֹמֶשׁ וַיִּשְׁפֹּךְ מֵעָיו אַרְצָה וְלֹא-שָׁנָה לוֹ--וַיָּמֹת; וְיוֹאָב, וַאֲבִישַׁי אָחִיו, רָדַף, אַחֲרֵי שֶׁבַע בֶּן-בִּכְרִי.
10.english: But Amasa took no heed to the sword that was in Joab's hand; so he smote him therewith in the groin, and shed out his bowels to the ground, and struck him not again; and he died. And Joab and Abishai his brother pursued after Sheba the son of Bichri.

11.hebrew: וְאִישׁ עָמַד עָלָיו, מִנַּעֲרֵי יוֹאָב; וַיֹּאמֶר, מִי אֲשֶׁר חָפֵץ בְּיוֹאָב וּמִי אֲשֶׁר-לְדָוִד--אַחֲרֵי יוֹאָב.
11.english: And there stood by him one of Joab's young men, and said: 'He that favoureth Joab, and he that is for David let him follow Joab.'

12.hebrew: וַעֲמָשָׂא מִתְגֹּלֵל בַּדָּם, בְּתוֹךְ הַמְסִלָּה; וַיַּרְא הָאִישׁ כִּי-עָמַד כָּל-הָעָם, וַיַּסֵּב אֶת-עֲמָשָׂא מִן-הַמְסִלָּה הַשָּׂדֶה וַיַּשְׁלֵךְ עָלָיו בֶּגֶד, כַּאֲשֶׁר רָאָה, כָּל-הַבָּא עָלָיו וְעָמָד.
12.english: And Amasa lay wallowing in his blood in the midst of the highway. And when the man saw that all the people stood still, he carried Amasa out of the highway into the field, and cast a garment over him, when he saw that every one that came by him stood still.

13.hebrew: כַּאֲשֶׁר הֹגָה, מִן-הַמְסִלָּה--עָבַר כָּל-אִישׁ, אַחֲרֵי יוֹאָב, לִרְדֹּף, אַחֲרֵי שֶׁבַע בֶּן-בִּכְרִי.
13.english: When he was removed out of the highway, all the people went on after Joab, to pursue after Sheba the son of Bichri.

14.hebrew: וַיַּעֲבֹר בְּכָל-שִׁבְטֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל, אָבֵלָה וּבֵית מַעֲכָה--וְכָל-הַבֵּרִים;  {ס}  ויקלהו (וַיִּקָּהֲלוּ), וַיָּבֹאוּ אַף-אַחֲרָיו.
14.english: And he went through all the tribes of Israel unto Abel, and to Beth-maacah, and all the Berites; {S} and they were gathered together, and went in also after him.

15.hebrew: וַיָּבֹאוּ וַיָּצֻרוּ עָלָיו, בְּאָבֵלָה בֵּית הַמַּעֲכָה, וַיִּשְׁפְּכוּ סֹלְלָה אֶל-הָעִיר, וַתַּעֲמֹד בַּחֵל; וְכָל-הָעָם אֲשֶׁר אֶת-יוֹאָב, מַשְׁחִיתִם לְהַפִּיל הַחוֹמָה.
15.english: And they came and besieged him in Abel of Beth-maacah, and they cast up a mound against the city, and it stood in the moat; and all the people that were with Joab battered the wall, to throw it down.

16.hebrew: וַתִּקְרָא אִשָּׁה חֲכָמָה, מִן-הָעִיר; שִׁמְעוּ שִׁמְעוּ, אִמְרוּ-נָא אֶל-יוֹאָב, קְרַב עַד-הֵנָּה, וַאֲדַבְּרָה אֵלֶיךָ.
16.english: Then cried a wise woman out of the city: 'Hear, hear; say, I pray you, unto Joab: Come near hither, that I may speak with thee.'

17.hebrew: וַיִּקְרַב אֵלֶיהָ, וַתֹּאמֶר הָאִשָּׁה הַאַתָּה יוֹאָב וַיֹּאמֶר אָנִי; וַתֹּאמֶר לוֹ, שְׁמַע דִּבְרֵי אֲמָתֶךָ, וַיֹּאמֶר, שֹׁמֵעַ אָנֹכִי.
17.english: And he came near unto her; and the woman said: 'Art thou Joab?' And he answered: 'I am.' Then she said unto him: 'Hear the words of thy handmaid.' And he answered: 'I do hear.'

18.hebrew: וַתֹּאמֶר, לֵאמֹר:  דַּבֵּר יְדַבְּרוּ בָרִאשֹׁנָה לֵאמֹר, שָׁאוֹל יְשָׁאֲלוּ בְּאָבֵל וְכֵן הֵתַמּוּ.
18.english: Then she spoke, saying: 'They were wont to speak in old time, saying: They shall surely ask counsel at Abel; and so they ended the matter.

19.hebrew: אָנֹכִי, שְׁלֻמֵי אֱמוּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל; אַתָּה מְבַקֵּשׁ, לְהָמִית עִיר וְאֵם בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל--לָמָּה תְבַלַּע, נַחֲלַת יְהוָה.  {פ}
19.english: We are of them that are peaceable and faithful in Israel; seekest thou to destroy a city and a mother in Israel? why wilt thou swallow up the inheritance of the LORD?' {P}

20.hebrew: וַיַּעַן יוֹאָב, וַיֹּאמַר:  חָלִילָה חָלִילָה לִי, אִם-אֲבַלַּע וְאִם-אַשְׁחִית.
20.english: And Joab answered and said: 'Far be it, far be it from me, that I should swallow up or destroy.

21.hebrew: לֹא-כֵן הַדָּבָר, כִּי אִישׁ מֵהַר אֶפְרַיִם שֶׁבַע בֶּן-בִּכְרִי שְׁמוֹ נָשָׂא יָדוֹ בַּמֶּלֶךְ בְּדָוִד--תְּנוּ-אֹתוֹ לְבַדּוֹ, וְאֵלְכָה מֵעַל הָעִיר; וַתֹּאמֶר הָאִשָּׁה אֶל-יוֹאָב, הִנֵּה רֹאשׁוֹ מֻשְׁלָךְ אֵלֶיךָ בְּעַד הַחוֹמָה.
21.english: The matter is not so; but a man of the hill-country of Ephraim, Sheba the son of Bichri by name, hath lifted up his hand against the king, even against David; deliver him only, and I will depart from the city.' And the woman said unto Joab: 'Behold, his head shall be thrown to thee over the wall.'

22.hebrew: וַתָּבוֹא הָאִשָּׁה אֶל-כָּל-הָעָם בְּחָכְמָתָהּ, וַיִּכְרְתוּ אֶת-רֹאשׁ שֶׁבַע בֶּן-בִּכְרִי וַיַּשְׁלִכוּ אֶל-יוֹאָב, וַיִּתְקַע בַּשֹּׁפָר, וַיָּפֻצוּ מֵעַל-הָעִיר אִישׁ לְאֹהָלָיו; וְיוֹאָב שָׁב יְרוּשָׁלִַם, אֶל-הַמֶּלֶךְ.  {ס}
22.english: Then the woman went unto all the people in her wisdom. And they cut off the head of Sheba the son of Bichri, and threw it out to Joab. And he blew the horn, and they were dispersed from the city, every man to his tent. And Joab returned to Jerusalem unto the king. {S}

23.hebrew: וְיוֹאָב, אֶל כָּל-הַצָּבָא יִשְׂרָאֵל; וּבְנָיָה, בֶּן-יְהוֹיָדָע, עַל-הכרי (הַכְּרֵתִי), וְעַל-הַפְּלֵתִי.
23.english: Now Joab was over all the host of Israel; and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada was over the Cherethites and over the Pelethites;

24.hebrew: וַאֲדֹרָם, עַל-הַמַּס; וִיהוֹשָׁפָט בֶּן-אֲחִילוּד, הַמַּזְכִּיר.
24.english: and Adoram was over the levy; and Jehoshaphat the son of Ahilud was the recorder;

25.hebrew: ושיא (וּשְׁוָא), סֹפֵר; וְצָדוֹק וְאֶבְיָתָר, כֹּהֲנִים.
25.english: and Sheva was scribe; and Zadok and Abiathar were priests;

26.hebrew: וְגַם, עִירָא הַיָּאִרִי, הָיָה כֹהֵן, לְדָוִד.  {ס}
26.english: and Ira also the Jairite was chief minister unto David. {S}

1.hebrew: וַיְהִי רָעָב בִּימֵי דָוִד שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים, שָׁנָה אַחֲרֵי שָׁנָה, וַיְבַקֵּשׁ דָּוִד, אֶת-פְּנֵי יְהוָה;  {ס}  וַיֹּאמֶר יְהוָה, אֶל-שָׁאוּל וְאֶל-בֵּית הַדָּמִים, עַל אֲשֶׁר-הֵמִית, אֶת-הַגִּבְעֹנִים.
1.english: And there was a famine in the days of David three years, year after year; and David sought the face of the LORD. {S} And the LORD said: 'It is for Saul, and for his bloody house, because he put to death the Gibeonites.'

2.hebrew: וַיִּקְרָא הַמֶּלֶךְ לַגִּבְעֹנִים, וַיֹּאמֶר אֲלֵיהֶם:  וְהַגִּבְעֹנִים לֹא מִבְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל הֵמָּה, כִּי אִם-מִיֶּתֶר הָאֱמֹרִי, וּבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל נִשְׁבְּעוּ לָהֶם, וַיְבַקֵּשׁ שָׁאוּל לְהַכֹּתָם בְּקַנֹּאתוֹ לִבְנֵי-יִשְׂרָאֵל וִיהוּדָה.
2.english: And the king called the Gibeonites, and said unto them--now the Gibeonites were not of the children of Israel, but of the remnant of the Amorites; and the children of Israel had sworn unto them; and Saul sought to slay them in his zeal for the children of Israel and Judah--

3.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר דָּוִד אֶל-הַגִּבְעֹנִים, מָה אֶעֱשֶׂה לָכֶם; וּבַמָּה אֲכַפֵּר, וּבָרְכוּ אֶת-נַחֲלַת יְהוָה.
3.english: and David said unto the Gibeonites: 'What shall I do for you? and wherewith shall I make atonement, that ye may bless the inheritance of the LORD?'

4.hebrew: וַיֹּאמְרוּ לוֹ הַגִּבְעֹנִים, אֵין-לי (לָנוּ) כֶּסֶף וְזָהָב עִם-שָׁאוּל וְעִם-בֵּיתוֹ, וְאֵין-לָנוּ אִישׁ, לְהָמִית בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל; וַיֹּאמֶר מָה-אַתֶּם אֹמְרִים, אֶעֱשֶׂה לָכֶם.
4.english: And the Gibeonites said unto him: 'It is no matter of silver or gold between us and Saul, or his house; neither is it for us to put any man to death in Israel.' And he said: 'What say ye that I should do for you?'

5.hebrew: וַיֹּאמְרוּ, אֶל-הַמֶּלֶךְ, הָאִישׁ אֲשֶׁר כִּלָּנוּ, וַאֲשֶׁר דִּמָּה-לָנוּ; נִשְׁמַדְנוּ, מֵהִתְיַצֵּב בְּכָל-גְּבֻל יִשְׂרָאֵל.
5.english: And they said unto the king: 'The man that consumed us, and that devised against us, so that we have been destroyed from remaining in any of the borders of Israel,

6.hebrew: ינתן- (יֻתַּן-) לָנוּ שִׁבְעָה אֲנָשִׁים, מִבָּנָיו, וְהוֹקַעֲנוּם לַיהוָה, בְּגִבְעַת שָׁאוּל בְּחִיר יְהוָה;  {פ} וַיֹּאמֶר הַמֶּלֶךְ, אֲנִי אֶתֵּן.
6.english: let seven men of his sons be delivered unto us, and we will hang them up unto the LORD in Gibeah of Saul, the chosen of the LORD.' {P}  And the king said: 'I will deliver them.'

7.hebrew: וַיַּחְמֹל הַמֶּלֶךְ, עַל-מְפִיבֹשֶׁת בֶּן-יְהוֹנָתָן בֶּן-שָׁאוּל; עַל-שְׁבֻעַת יְהוָה, אֲשֶׁר בֵּינֹתָם--בֵּין דָּוִד, וּבֵין יְהוֹנָתָן בֶּן-שָׁאוּל.
7.english: But the king spared Mephibosheth, the son of Jonathan the son of Saul, because of the LORD'S oath that was between them, between David and Jonathan the son of Saul.

8.hebrew: וַיִּקַּח הַמֶּלֶךְ אֶת-שְׁנֵי בְּנֵי רִצְפָּה בַת-אַיָּה, אֲשֶׁר יָלְדָה לְשָׁאוּל, אֶת-אַרְמֹנִי, וְאֶת-מְפִבֹשֶׁת; וְאֶת-חֲמֵשֶׁת, בְּנֵי מִיכַל בַּת-שָׁאוּל, אֲשֶׁר יָלְדָה לְעַדְרִיאֵל בֶּן-בַּרְזִלַּי, הַמְּחֹלָתִי.
8.english: But the king took the two sons of Rizpah the daughter of Aiah, whom she bore unto Saul, Armoni and Mephibosheth; and the five sons of Michal the daughter of Saul, whom she bore to Adriel the son of Barzillai the Meholathite;

9.hebrew: וַיִּתְּנֵם בְּיַד הַגִּבְעֹנִים, וַיֹּקִיעֻם בָּהָר לִפְנֵי יְהוָה, וַיִּפְּלוּ שבעתים (שְׁבַעְתָּם), יָחַד; והם (וְהֵמָּה) הֻמְתוּ בִּימֵי קָצִיר, בָּרִאשֹׁנִים, תחלת (בִּתְחִלַּת), קְצִיר שְׂעֹרִים.
9.english: and he delivered them into the hands of the Gibeonites, and they hanged them in the mountain before the LORD, and they fell all seven together; and they were put to death in the days of harvest, in the first days, at the beginning of barley harvest.

10.hebrew: וַתִּקַּח רִצְפָּה בַת-אַיָּה אֶת-הַשַּׂק וַתַּטֵּהוּ לָהּ אֶל-הַצּוּר, מִתְּחִלַּת קָצִיר, עַד נִתַּךְ-מַיִם עֲלֵיהֶם, מִן-הַשָּׁמָיִם; וְלֹא-נָתְנָה עוֹף הַשָּׁמַיִם לָנוּחַ עֲלֵיהֶם, יוֹמָם, וְאֶת-חַיַּת הַשָּׂדֶה, לָיְלָה.
10.english: And Rizpah the daughter of Aiah took sackcloth, and spread it for her upon the rock, from the beginning of harvest until water was poured upon them from heaven; and she suffered neither the birds of the air to rest on them by day, nor the beasts of the field by night.

11.hebrew: וַיֻּגַּד, לְדָוִד, אֵת אֲשֶׁר-עָשְׂתָה רִצְפָּה בַת-אַיָּה, פִּלֶגֶשׁ שָׁאוּל.
11.english: And it was told David what Rizpah the daughter of Aiah, the concubine of Saul, had done.

12.hebrew: וַיֵּלֶךְ דָּוִד, וַיִּקַּח אֶת-עַצְמוֹת שָׁאוּל וְאֶת-עַצְמוֹת יְהוֹנָתָן בְּנוֹ, מֵאֵת, בַּעֲלֵי יָבֵישׁ גִּלְעָד--אֲשֶׁר גָּנְבוּ אֹתָם מֵרְחֹב בֵּית-שַׁן, אֲשֶׁר תלום (תְּלָאוּם) שם הפלשתים (שָׁמָּה פְּלִשְׁתִּים), בְּיוֹם הַכּוֹת פְּלִשְׁתִּים אֶת-שָׁאוּל, בַּגִּלְבֹּעַ.
12.english: And David went and took the bones of Saul and the bones of Jonathan his son from the men of Jabesh-gilead, who had stolen them from the broad place of Beth-shan, where the Philistines had hanged them, in the day that the Philistines slew Saul in Gilboa;

13.hebrew: וַיַּעַל מִשָּׁם אֶת-עַצְמוֹת שָׁאוּל, וְאֶת-עַצְמוֹת יְהוֹנָתָן בְּנוֹ; וַיַּאַסְפוּ, אֶת-עַצְמוֹת הַמּוּקָעִים.
13.english: and he brought up from thence the bones of Saul and the bones of Jonathan his son; and they gathered the bones of them that were hanged.

14.hebrew: וַיִּקְבְּרוּ אֶת-עַצְמוֹת-שָׁאוּל וִיהוֹנָתָן-בְּנוֹ בְּאֶרֶץ בִּנְיָמִן בְּצֵלָע, בְּקֶבֶר קִישׁ אָבִיו, וַיַּעֲשׂוּ, כֹּל אֲשֶׁר-צִוָּה הַמֶּלֶךְ; וַיֵּעָתֵר אֱלֹהִים לָאָרֶץ, אַחֲרֵי-כֵן.  {פ}
14.english: And they buried the bones of Saul and Jonathan his son in the country of Benjamin in Zela, in the sepulchre of Kish his father; and they performed all that the king commanded. And after that God was entreated for the land. {P}

15.hebrew: וַתְּהִי-עוֹד מִלְחָמָה לַפְּלִשְׁתִּים, אֶת-יִשְׂרָאֵל; וַיֵּרֶד דָּוִד וַעֲבָדָיו עִמּוֹ, וַיִּלָּחֲמוּ אֶת-פְּלִשְׁתִּים--וַיָּעַף דָּוִד.
15.english: And the Philistines had war again with Israel; and David went down, and his servants with him, and fought against the Philistines; and David waxed faint.

16.hebrew: וישבו (וְיִשְׁבִּי) בְּנֹב אֲשֶׁר בִּילִידֵי הָרָפָה, וּמִשְׁקַל קֵינוֹ שְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת מִשְׁקַל נְחֹשֶׁת, וְהוּא, חָגוּר חֲדָשָׁה; וַיֹּאמֶר, לְהַכּוֹת אֶת-דָּוִד.
16.english: And Ishbibenob, who was of the sons of the giant, the weight of whose spear was three hundred shekels of brass in weight, he being girded with new armour, thought to have slain David.

17.hebrew: וַיַּעֲזָר-לוֹ אֲבִישַׁי בֶּן-צְרוּיָה, וַיַּךְ אֶת-הַפְּלִשְׁתִּי וַיְמִתֵהוּ; אָז נִשְׁבְּעוּ אַנְשֵׁי-דָוִד לוֹ לֵאמֹר, לֹא-תֵצֵא עוֹד אִתָּנוּ לַמִּלְחָמָה, וְלֹא תְכַבֶּה, אֶת-נֵר יִשְׂרָאֵל.  {פ}
17.english: But Abishai the son of Zeruiah succoured him, and smote the Philistine, and killed him. Then the men of David swore unto him, saying: 'Thou shalt go no more out with us to battle, that thou quench not the lamp of Israel.' {P}

18.hebrew: וַיְהִי, אַחֲרֵי-כֵן, וַתְּהִי-עוֹד הַמִּלְחָמָה בְּגוֹב, עִם-פְּלִשְׁתִּים; אָז הִכָּה, סִבְּכַי הַחֻשָׁתִי, אֶת-סַף, אֲשֶׁר בִּילִדֵי הָרָפָה.  {ס}
18.english: And it came to pass after this, that there was again war with the Philistines at Gob; then Sibbecai the Hushathite slew Saph, who was of the sons of the giant. {S}

19.hebrew: וַתְּהִי-עוֹד הַמִּלְחָמָה בְּגוֹב, עִם-פְּלִשְׁתִּים; וַיַּךְ אֶלְחָנָן בֶּן-יַעְרֵי אֹרְגִים בֵּית הַלַּחְמִי, אֵת גָּלְיָת הַגִּתִּי, וְעֵץ חֲנִיתוֹ, כִּמְנוֹר אֹרְגִים.  {ס}
19.english: And there was again war with the Philistines at Gob; and Elhanan the son of Jaare-oregim the Beth-lehemite slew Goliath the Gittite, the staff of whose spear was like a weaver's beam. {S}

20.hebrew: וַתְּהִי-עוֹד מִלְחָמָה, בְּגַת; וַיְהִי אִישׁ מדין (מָדוֹן), וְאֶצְבְּעֹת יָדָיו וְאֶצְבְּעֹת רַגְלָיו שֵׁשׁ וָשֵׁשׁ עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבַּע מִסְפָּר, וְגַם-הוּא, יֻלַּד לְהָרָפָה.
20.english: And there was again war at Gath, where was a champion, that had on every hand six fingers, and on every foot six toes, four and twenty in number; and he also was born to the giant.

21.hebrew: וַיְחָרֵף, אֶת-יִשְׂרָאֵל; וַיַּכֵּהוּ, יְהוֹנָתָן, בֶּן-שמעי (שִׁמְעָה), אֲחִי דָוִד.
21.english: And when he taunted Israel, Jonathan the son of Shimea David's brother slew him.

22.hebrew: אֶת-אַרְבַּעַת אֵלֶּה יֻלְּדוּ לְהָרָפָה, בְּגַת; וַיִּפְּלוּ בְיַד-דָּוִד, וּבְיַד עֲבָדָיו.  {ש}
22.english: These four were born to the giant in Gath; and they fell by the hand of David, and by the hand of his servants. {P}

26.english: With the merciful Thou dost show Thyself merciful, with the upright man Thou dost show Thyself upright,

27.english: With the pure Thou dost show Thyself pure; and with the crooked Thou dost show Thyself subtle.

28.english: And the afflicted people Thou dost save; but Thine eyes are upon the haughty, that Thou mayest humble them.

29.english: For Thou art my lamp, O LORD; and the LORD doth lighten my darkness.

30.english: For by Thee I run upon a troop; by my God do I scale a wall.

31.hebrew: ††д»а≈м, ъћ»оƒйн гћ«шјлће…; аƒојш«ъ йјде»д, цјшећф»д--† {с}† о»в≈п дећа, мјл…м д«з…сƒйн бће….† {ш}
31.english: As for God, His way is perfect; the word of the LORD is tried; He is a shield unto all them that take refuge in Him.

32.english: For who is God, save the LORD? and who is a Rock, save our God?

33.english: The God who is my strong fortress, and who letteth my way go forth straight;

34.english: Who maketh my feet like hinds', and setteth me upon my high places;

35.english: Who traineth my hands for war, so that mine arms do bend a bow of brass.

36.english: Thou hast also given me Thy shield of salvation; and Thy condescension hath made me great.

37.english: Thou hast enlarged my steps under me, and my feet have not slipped.

38.english: I have pursued mine enemies, and destroyed them; neither did I turn back till they were consumed.

39.hebrew: ††е»а¬л«мћ≈н е»а∆ојз»ц≈н, ејм…а йјчећоећп;† {с}† е«йћƒфћјмећ, ъћ«з«ъ ш«вјм»й.† {ш}
39.english: And I have consumed them, and smitten them through, that they cannot arise; yea, they are fallen under my feet.

40.english: For Thou hast girded me with strength unto the battle; Thou hast subdued under me those that rose up against me.

41.english: Thou hast also made mine enemies turn their backs unto me; yea, them that hate me, that I might cut them off.

42.english: They looked, but there was none to save; even unto the LORD, but He answered them not.

43.english: Then did I beat them small as the dust of the earth, I did stamp them as the mire of the streets, and did tread them down.

46.english: The sons of the stranger fade away, and come halting out of their close places.

49.english: And that bringeth me forth from mine enemies; yea, Thou liftest me up above them that rise up against me; Thou deliverest me from the violent man.

50.english: Therefore I will give thanks unto Thee, O LORD, among the nations, and will sing praises unto Thy name.

51.english: A tower of salvation is He to His king; and showeth mercy to His anointed, to David and to his seed, for evermore. {P}

1.hebrew: וְאֵלֶּה דִּבְרֵי דָוִד, הָאַחֲרֹנִים:  נְאֻם דָּוִד בֶּן-יִשַׁי, וּנְאֻם הַגֶּבֶר הֻקַם עָל--מְשִׁיחַ אֱלֹהֵי יַעֲקֹב, וּנְעִים זְמִרוֹת יִשְׂרָאֵל.
1.english: Now these are the last words of David: The saying of David the son of Jesse, and the saying of the man raised on high, the anointed of the God of Jacob, and the sweet singer of Israel:

2.hebrew: רוּחַ יְהוָה, דִּבֶּר-בִּי; וּמִלָּתוֹ, עַל-לְשׁוֹנִי.
2.english: The spirit of the LORD spoke by me, and His word was upon my tongue.

3.hebrew: אָמַר אֱלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל, לִי דִבֶּר צוּר יִשְׂרָאֵל:  מוֹשֵׁל, בָּאָדָם--צַדִּיק, מוֹשֵׁל יִרְאַת אֱלֹהִים.
3.english: The God of Israel said, The Rock of Israel spoke to me: 'Ruler over men shall be the righteous, even he that ruleth in the fear of God,

4.hebrew: וּכְאוֹר בֹּקֶר, יִזְרַח-שָׁמֶשׁ; בֹּקֶר לֹא עָבוֹת, מִנֹּגַהּ מִמָּטָר דֶּשֶׁא מֵאָרֶץ.
4.english: And as the light of the morning, when the sun riseth, a morning without clouds; when through clear shining after rain, the tender grass springeth out of the earth.'

5.hebrew: כִּי-לֹא-כֵן בֵּיתִי, עִם-אֵל:  כִּי בְרִית עוֹלָם שָׂם לִי, עֲרוּכָה בַכֹּל וּשְׁמֻרָה--כִּי-כָל-יִשְׁעִי וְכָל-חֵפֶץ, כִּי-לֹא יַצְמִיחַ.
5.english: For is not my house established with God? for an everlasting covenant He hath made with me, ordered in all things, and sure; for all my salvation, and all my desire, will he not make it to grow?

6.hebrew: וּבְלִיַּעַל, כְּקוֹץ מֻנָד כֻּלָּהַם:  כִּי-לֹא בְיָד, יִקָּחוּ.
6.english: But the ungodly, they are as thorns thrust away, all of them, for they cannot be taken with the hand;

7.hebrew: וְאִישׁ יִגַּע בָּהֶם, יִמָּלֵא בַרְזֶל וְעֵץ חֲנִית; וּבָאֵשׁ, שָׂרוֹף יִשָּׂרְפוּ בַּשָּׁבֶת.  {פ}
7.english: But the man that toucheth them must be armed with iron and the staff of a spear; and they shall be utterly burned with fire in their place. {P}

8.hebrew: אֵלֶּה שְׁמוֹת הַגִּבֹּרִים, אֲשֶׁר לְדָוִד:  יֹשֵׁב בַּשֶּׁבֶת תַּחְכְּמֹנִי רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁלִשִׁי, הוּא עֲדִינוֹ העצנו (הָעֶצְנִי)--עַל-שְׁמֹנֶה מֵאוֹת חָלָל, בְּפַעַם אחד (אֶחָת).  {ס}
8.english: These are the names of the mighty men whom David had: Josheb-basshebeth a Tahchemonite, chief of the captains; the same was Adino the Eznite; [he lifted up his spear] against eight hundred, whom he slew at one time. {S}

9.hebrew: וְאַחֲרָו אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן-דדי (דֹּדוֹ), בֶּן-אֲחֹחִי; בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה גברים (הַגִּבֹּרִים) עִם-דָּוִד, בְּחָרְפָם בַּפְּלִשְׁתִּים נֶאֶסְפוּ-שָׁם לַמִּלְחָמָה, וַיַּעֲלוּ, אִישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵל.
9.english: And after him was Eleazar the son of Dodo the son of an Ahohite, one of the three mighty men with David, when they jeoparded their lives against the Philistines that were there gathered together to battle, and the men of Israel were gone away;

10.hebrew: הוּא קָם וַיַּךְ בַּפְּלִשְׁתִּים עַד כִּי-יָגְעָה יָדוֹ, וַתִּדְבַּק יָדוֹ אֶל-הַחֶרֶב, וַיַּעַשׂ יְהוָה תְּשׁוּעָה גְדוֹלָה, בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא; וְהָעָם יָשֻׁבוּ אַחֲרָיו, אַךְ-לְפַשֵּׁט.  {ס}
10.english: he stood firm, and smote the Philistines until his hand was weary, and his hand did cleave unto the sword; and the LORD wrought a great victory that day; and the people returned after him only to strip the slain. {S}

11.hebrew: וְאַחֲרָיו שַׁמָּה בֶן-אָגֵא, הָרָרִי; וַיֵּאָסְפוּ פְלִשְׁתִּים לַחַיָּה, וַתְּהִי-שָׁם חֶלְקַת הַשָּׂדֶה מְלֵאָה עֲדָשִׁים, וְהָעָם נָס, מִפְּנֵי פְלִשְׁתִּים.
11.english: And after him was Shammah the son of Age the Ararite. And the Philistines were gathered together into a troop, where was a plot of ground full of lentils; and the people fled from the Philistines.

12.hebrew: וַיִּתְיַצֵּב בְּתוֹךְ-הַחֶלְקָה וַיַּצִּילֶהָ, וַיַּךְ אֶת-פְּלִשְׁתִּים; וַיַּעַשׂ יְהוָה, תְּשׁוּעָה גְדוֹלָה.  {ס}
12.english: But he stood in the midst of the plot, and defended it, and slew the Philistines; and the LORD wrought a great victory. {S}

13.hebrew: וַיֵּרְדוּ שלשים (שְׁלֹשָׁה) מֵהַשְּׁלֹשִׁים רֹאשׁ, וַיָּבֹאוּ אֶל-קָצִיר אֶל-דָּוִד--אֶל-מְעָרַת, עֲדֻלָּם; וְחַיַּת פְּלִשְׁתִּים, חֹנָה בְּעֵמֶק רְפָאִים.
13.english: And three of the thirty chief went down, and came to David in the harvest time unto the cave of Adullam; and the troop of the Philistines were encamped in the valley of Rephaim.

14.hebrew: וְדָוִד, אָז בַּמְּצוּדָה; וּמַצַּב פְּלִשְׁתִּים, אָז בֵּית לָחֶם.
14.english: And David was then in the stronghold, and the garrison of the Philistines was then in Beth-lehem.

15.hebrew: וַיִּתְאַוֶּה דָוִד, וַיֹּאמַר:  מִי יַשְׁקֵנִי מַיִם, מִבֹּאר בֵּית-לֶחֶם אֲשֶׁר בַּשָּׁעַר.  {ס}
15.english: And David longed, and said: 'Oh that one would give me water to drink of the well of Beth-lehem, which is by the gate!' {S}

16.hebrew: וַיִּבְקְעוּ שְׁלֹשֶׁת הַגִּבֹּרִים בְּמַחֲנֵה פְלִשְׁתִּים, וַיִּשְׁאֲבוּ-מַיִם מִבֹּאר בֵּית-לֶחֶם אֲשֶׁר בַּשַּׁעַר, וַיִּשְׂאוּ, וַיָּבִאוּ אֶל-דָּוִד; וְלֹא אָבָה לִשְׁתּוֹתָם, וַיַּסֵּךְ אֹתָם לַיהוָה.
16.english: And the three mighty men broke through the host of the Philistines, and drew water out of the well of Beth-lehem, that was by the gate, and took it, and brought it to David; but he would not drink thereof, but poured it out unto the LORD.

17.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר חָלִילָה לִּי יְהוָה מֵעֲשֹׂתִי זֹאת, הֲדַם הָאֲנָשִׁים הַהֹלְכִים בְּנַפְשׁוֹתָם, וְלֹא אָבָה, לִשְׁתּוֹתָם; אֵלֶּה עָשׂוּ, שְׁלֹשֶׁת הַגִּבֹּרִים.  {ס}
17.english: And he said: 'Be it far from me, O LORD, that I should do this; shall I drink the blood of the men that went in jeopardy of their lives?' therefore he would not drink it. These things did the three mighty men. {S}

18.hebrew: וַאֲבִישַׁי אֲחִי יוֹאָב בֶּן-צְרוּיָה, הוּא רֹאשׁ השלשי (הַשְּׁלֹשָׁה), וְהוּא עוֹרֵר אֶת-חֲנִיתוֹ, עַל-שְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת חָלָל; וְלוֹ-שֵׁם, בַּשְּׁלֹשָׁה.
18.english: And Abishai, the brother of Joab, the son of Zeruiah, was chief of the three. And he lifted up his spear against three hundred and slew them, and had a name among the three.

19.hebrew: מִן-הַשְּׁלֹשָׁה הֲכִי נִכְבָּד, וַיְהִי לָהֶם לְשָׂר; וְעַד-הַשְּׁלֹשָׁה, לֹא-בָא.  {ס}
19.english: He was most honourable of the three; therefore he was made their captain; howbeit he attained not unto the first three. {S}

20.hebrew: וּבְנָיָהוּ בֶן-יְהוֹיָדָע בֶּן-אִישׁ-חי (חַיִל) רַב-פְּעָלִים, מִקַּבְצְאֵל; הוּא הִכָּה, אֵת שְׁנֵי אֲרִאֵל מוֹאָב, וְהוּא יָרַד וְהִכָּה אֶת-האריה (הָאֲרִי) בְּתוֹךְ הַבֹּאר, בְּיוֹם הַשָּׁלֶג.
20.english: And Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, the son of a valiant man of Kabzeel, who had done mighty deeds, he smote the two altar-hearths of Moab; he went down also and slew a lion in the midst of a pit in time of snow;

21.hebrew: וְהוּא-הִכָּה אֶת-אִישׁ מִצְרִי אשר (אִישׁ) מַרְאֶה, וּבְיַד הַמִּצְרִי חֲנִית, וַיֵּרֶד אֵלָיו, בַּשָּׁבֶט; וַיִּגְזֹל אֶת-הַחֲנִית מִיַּד הַמִּצְרִי, וַיַּהַרְגֵהוּ בַּחֲנִיתוֹ.
21.english: and he slew an Egyptian, a goodly man; and the Egyptian had a spear in his hand; but he went down to him with a staff, and plucked the spear out of the Egyptian's hand, and slew him with his own spear.

22.hebrew: אֵלֶּה עָשָׂה, בְּנָיָהוּ בֶּן-יְהוֹיָדָע; וְלוֹ-שֵׁם, בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה הַגִּבֹּרִים.
22.english: These things did Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and had a name among the three mighty men.

23.hebrew: מִן-הַשְּׁלֹשִׁים נִכְבָּד, וְאֶל-הַשְּׁלֹשָׁה לֹא-בָא; וַיְשִׂמֵהוּ דָוִד,  {ר}  אֶל-מִשְׁמַעְתּוֹ.  {ס}
23.english: He was more honourable than the thirty, but he attained not to the first three. And David set him over his guard.

24.hebrew: עֲשָׂהאֵל אֲחִי-יוֹאָב, בַּשְּׁלֹשִׁים; אֶלְחָנָן בֶּן-דֹּדוֹ,  {ר}  בֵּית לָחֶם.  {ס}
24.english: Asahel the brother of Joab was one of the thirty; Elhanan the son of Dodo of Beth-lehem;

25.hebrew: שַׁמָּה, הַחֲרֹדִי,  {ס}  אֱלִיקָא,  {ר}  הַחֲרֹדִי.  {ס}
25.english: Shammah the Harodite, Elika the Harodite;

26.english: Helez the Paltite, Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite;

27.english: Abiezer the Anathothite, Mebunnai the Hushathite;

28.english: Zalmon the Ahohite, Maharai the Netophathite;

29.hebrew: חֵלֶב בֶּן-בַּעֲנָה,  {ר}  הַנְּטֹפָתִי;  {ס}  אִתַּי, בֶּן-רִיבַי, מִגִּבְעַת, בְּנֵי בִנְיָמִן.  {ס}
29.english: Heleb the son of Baanah the Netophathite, Ittai the son of Ribai of Gibeah of the children of Benjamin;

30.english: Benaiah a Pirathonite, Hiddai of Nahale-gaash;

31.english: Abi-albon the Arbathite, Azmaveth the Barhumite;

32.english: Eliahba the Shaalbonite, of the sons of Jashen, Jonathan;

33.english: Shammah the Hararite, Ahiam the son of Sharar the Ararite;

34.hebrew: אֱלִיפֶלֶט  {ר}  בֶּן-אֲחַסְבַּי, בֶּן-הַמַּעֲכָתִי;  {ס}  אֱלִיעָם בֶּן-אֲחִיתֹפֶל,  {ר}  הַגִּלֹנִי.  {ס}
34.english: Eliphelet the son of Ahasbai, the son of the Maacathite, Eliam the son of Ahithophel the Gilonite;

35.english: Hezrai the Carmelite, Paarai the Arbite;

36.english: Igal the son of Nathan of Zobah, Bani the Gadite;

37.hebrew: צֶלֶק, הָעַמֹּנִי;  {ס}  נַחְרַי,  {ר}  הַבְּאֵרֹתִי--נשאי (נֹשֵׂא), כְּלֵי יוֹאָב בֶּן-צְרֻיָה.  {ס}
37.english: Zelek the Ammonite, Naharai the Beerothite, armour-bearer to Joab the son of Zeruiah;

38.english: Ira the Ithrite, Gareb the Ithrite;

39.english: Uriah the Hittite. Thirty and seven in all. {P}

20.english: And it was so, as she rode on her ass, and came down by the covert of the mountain, that, behold, David and his men came down towards her; and she met them.--

23.english: And when Abigail saw David, she made haste, and alighted from her ass, and fell before David on her face, and bowed down to the ground.

24.english: And she fell at his feet, and said: 'Upon me, my lord, upon me be the iniquity; and let thy handmaid, I pray thee, speak in thine ears, and hear thou the words of thy handmaid.

25.english: Let not my lord, I pray thee, regard this base fellow, even Nabal; for as his name is, so is he: Nabal is his name, and churlishness is with him; but I thy handmaid saw not the young men of my lord, whom thou didst send.

26.english: Now therefore, my lord, as the LORD liveth, and as thy soul liveth, seeing the LORD hath withholden thee from bloodguiltiness, and from finding redress for thyself with thine own hand, now therefore let thine enemies, and them that seek evil to my lord, be as Nabal.

27.english: And now this present which thy servant hath brought unto my lord, let it be given unto the young men that follow my lord.

28.english: Forgive, I pray thee, the trespass of thy handmaid; for the LORD will certainly make my lord a sure house, because my lord fighteth the battles of the LORD; and evil is not found in thee all thy days.

29.english: And though man be risen up to pursue thee, and to seek thy soul, yet the soul of my lord shall be bound in the bundle of life with the LORD thy God; and the souls of thine enemies, them shall he sling out, as from the hollow of a sling.

30.english: And it shall come to pass, when the LORD shall have done to my lord according to all the good that He hath spoken concerning thee, and shall have appointed thee prince over Israel;

31.english: that this shall be no stumbling-block unto thee, nor offence of heart unto my lord, either that thou hast shed blood without cause, or that my lord hath found redress for himself. And when the LORD shall have dealt well with my lord, then remember thy handmaid.' {S}

32.english: And David said to Abigail: 'Blessed be the LORD, the God of Israel, who sent thee this day to meet me;

33.english: and blessed be thy discretion, and blessed be thou, that hast kept me this day from bloodguiltiness, and from finding redress for myself with mine own hand.

34.english: For in very deed, as the LORD, the God of Israel, liveth, who hath withholden me from hurting thee, except thou hadst made haste and come to meet me, surely there had not been left unto Nabal by the morning light so much as one male.'

35.english: So David received of her hand that which she had brought him; and he said unto her: 'Go up in peace to thy house; see, I have hearkened to thy voice, and have accepted thy person.'

36.english: And Abigail came to Nabal; and, behold, he held a feast in his house, like the feast of a king; and Nabal's heart was merry within him, for he was very drunken; wherefore she told him nothing, less or more, until the morning light.

37.english: And it came to pass in the morning, when the wine was gone out of Nabal, that his wife told him these things, and his heart died within him, and he became as a stone.

38.english: And it came to pass about ten days after, that the LORD smote Nabal, so that he died.

39.english: And when David heard that Nabal was dead, he said: 'Blessed be the LORD, that hath pleaded the cause of my reproach from the hand of Nabal, and hath kept back His servant from evil; and the evil-doing of Nabal hath the LORD returned upon his own head.' And David sent and spoke concerning Abigail, to take her to him to wife.

40.english: And when the servants of David were come to Abigail to Carmel, they spoke unto her, saying: 'David hath sent us unto thee, to take thee to him to wife.'

41.english: And she arose, and bowed down with her face to the earth, and said: 'Behold, thy handmaid is a servant to wash the feet of the servants of my lord.'

42.english: And Abigail hastened, and arose, and rode upon an ass, with five damsels of hers that followed her; and she went after the messengers of David, and became his wife.

43.english: David also took Ahinoam of Jezreel; and they became both of them his wives. {S}

44.hebrew: ††ејщ—»аећм, р»ъ«п а∆ъ-оƒйл«м бћƒъће…--а≈щ—∆ъ гћ»еƒг:† мјф«мјиƒй б∆п-м«йƒщ—, а¬щ—∆ш оƒвћ«мћƒйн.
44.english: Now Saul had given Michal his daughter, David's wife, to Palti the son of Laish, who was of Gallim.

1.hebrew: וַיָּבֹאוּ הַזִּפִים אֶל-שָׁאוּל, הַגִּבְעָתָה לֵאמֹר:  הֲלוֹא דָוִד מִסְתַּתֵּר בְּגִבְעַת הַחֲכִילָה, עַל פְּנֵי הַיְשִׁימֹן.
1.english: And the Ziphites came unto Saul to Gibeah, saying: 'Doth not David hide himself in the hill of Hachilah, which is before Jeshimon?'

2.hebrew: וַיָּקָם שָׁאוּל, וַיֵּרֶד אֶל-מִדְבַּר-זִיף, וְאִתּוֹ שְׁלֹשֶׁת-אֲלָפִים אִישׁ, בְּחוּרֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל--לְבַקֵּשׁ אֶת-דָּוִד, בְּמִדְבַּר-זִיף.
2.english: Then Saul arose, and went down to the wilderness of Ziph, having three thousand chosen men of Israel with him, to seek David in the wilderness of Ziph.

3.hebrew: וַיִּחַן שָׁאוּל בְּגִבְעַת הַחֲכִילָה, אֲשֶׁר עַל-פְּנֵי הַיְשִׁימֹן--עַל-הַדָּרֶךְ; וְדָוִד, יֹשֵׁב בַּמִּדְבָּר, וַיַּרְא, כִּי בָא שָׁאוּל אַחֲרָיו הַמִּדְבָּרָה.
3.english: And Saul pitched in the hill of Hachilah, which is before Jeshimon, by the way. But David abode in the wilderness, and he saw that Saul came after him into the wilderness.

4.hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַח דָּוִד, מְרַגְּלִים; וַיֵּדַע, כִּי-בָא שָׁאוּל אֶל-נָכוֹן.
4.english: David therefore sent out spies, and understood that Saul was come of a certainty.

5.hebrew: וַיָּקָם דָּוִד, וַיָּבֹא אֶל-הַמָּקוֹם אֲשֶׁר חָנָה-שָׁם שָׁאוּל, וַיַּרְא דָּוִד אֶת-הַמָּקוֹם אֲשֶׁר שָׁכַב-שָׁם שָׁאוּל, וְאַבְנֵר בֶּן-נֵר שַׂר-צְבָאוֹ; וְשָׁאוּל שֹׁכֵב בַּמַּעְגָּל, וְהָעָם חֹנִים סְבִיבֹתָו.
5.english: And David arose, and came to the place where Saul had pitched; and David beheld the place where Saul lay, and Abner the son of Ner, the captain of his host; and Saul lay within the barricade, and the people pitched round about him.

6.hebrew: וַיַּעַן דָּוִד וַיֹּאמֶר אֶל-אֲחִימֶלֶךְ הַחִתִּי, וְאֶל-אֲבִישַׁי בֶּן-צְרוּיָה אֲחִי יוֹאָב לֵאמֹר, מִי-יֵרֵד אִתִּי אֶל-שָׁאוּל, אֶל-הַמַּחֲנֶה; וַיֹּאמֶר אֲבִישַׁי, אֲנִי אֵרֵד עִמָּךְ.
6.english: Then answered David and said to Ahimelech the Hittite, and to Abishai the son of Zeruiah, brother to Joab, saying: 'Who will go down with me to Saul to the camp?' And Abishai said: 'I will go down with thee.'

7.hebrew: וַיָּבֹא דָוִד וַאֲבִישַׁי אֶל-הָעָם, לַיְלָה, וְהִנֵּה שָׁאוּל שֹׁכֵב יָשֵׁן בַּמַּעְגָּל, וַחֲנִיתוֹ מְעוּכָה-בָאָרֶץ מְרַאֲשֹׁתָו; וְאַבְנֵר וְהָעָם, שֹׁכְבִים סְבִיבֹתָו.  {ס}
7.english: So David and Abishai came to the people by night; and, behold, Saul lay sleeping within the barricade, with his spear stuck in the ground at his head; and Abner and the people lay round about him. {S}

8.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר אֲבִישַׁי אֶל-דָּוִד, סִגַּר אֱלֹהִים הַיּוֹם אֶת-אוֹיִבְךָ בְּיָדֶךָ; וְעַתָּה אַכֶּנּוּ נָא בַּחֲנִית וּבָאָרֶץ, פַּעַם אַחַת, וְלֹא אֶשְׁנֶה, לוֹ.
8.english: Then said Abishai to David: 'God hath delivered up thine enemy into thy hand this day; now therefore let me smite him, I pray thee, with the spear to the earth at one stroke, and I will not smite him the second time.'

9.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר דָּוִד אֶל-אֲבִישַׁי, אַל-תַּשְׁחִיתֵהוּ:  כִּי מִי שָׁלַח יָדוֹ, בִּמְשִׁיחַ יְהוָה--וְנִקָּה.  {פ}
9.english: And David said to Abishai: 'Destroy him not; for who can put forth his hand against the LORD'S anointed, and be guiltless?' {P}

10.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר דָּוִד חַי-יְהוָה, כִּי אִם-יְהוָה יִגֳּפֶנּוּ; אוֹ-יוֹמוֹ יָבוֹא וָמֵת, אוֹ בַמִּלְחָמָה יֵרֵד וְנִסְפָּה.
10.english: And David said: 'As the LORD liveth, nay, but the LORD shall smite him; or his day shall come to die; or he shall go down into battle, and be swept away.

11.hebrew: חָלִילָה לִּי מֵיְהוָה, מִשְּׁלֹחַ יָדִי בִּמְשִׁיחַ יְהוָה; וְעַתָּה קַח-נָא אֶת-הַחֲנִית אֲשֶׁר מְרַאֲשֹׁתָו, וְאֶת-צַפַּחַת הַמַּיִם--וְנֵלְכָה-לָּנוּ.
11.english: The LORD forbid it me, that I should put forth my hand against the LORD'S anointed; but now take, I pray thee, the spear that is at his head, and the cruse of water and let us go.'

12.hebrew: וַיִּקַּח דָּוִד אֶת-הַחֲנִית וְאֶת-צַפַּחַת הַמַּיִם, מֵרַאֲשֹׁתֵי שָׁאוּל, וַיֵּלְכוּ, לָהֶם; וְאֵין רֹאֶה וְאֵין יוֹדֵעַ וְאֵין מֵקִיץ, כִּי כֻלָּם יְשֵׁנִים--כִּי תַּרְדֵּמַת יְהוָה, נָפְלָה עֲלֵיהֶם.
12.english: So David took the spear and the cruse of water from Saul's head; and they got them away, and no man saw it, nor knew it, neither did any awake; for they were all asleep; because a deep sleep from the LORD was fallen upon them.

13.hebrew: וַיַּעֲבֹר דָּוִד הָעֵבֶר, וַיַּעֲמֹד עַל-רֹאשׁ-הָהָר מֵרָחֹק:  רַב הַמָּקוֹם, בֵּינֵיהֶם.
13.english: Then David went over to the other side, and stood on the top of the mountain afar off; a great space being between them.

14.hebrew: וַיִּקְרָא דָוִד אֶל-הָעָם, וְאֶל-אַבְנֵר בֶּן-נֵר לֵאמֹר, הֲלוֹא תַעֲנֶה, אַבְנֵר; וַיַּעַן אַבְנֵר וַיֹּאמֶר, מִי אַתָּה קָרָאתָ אֶל-הַמֶּלֶךְ.  {פ}
14.english: And David cried to the people, and to Abner the son of Ner, saying: 'Answerest thou not, Abner?' Then Abner answered and said: 'Who art thou that criest to the king?' {P}

15.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר דָּוִד אֶל-אַבְנֵר הֲלוֹא-אִישׁ אַתָּה, וּמִי כָמוֹךָ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל, וְלָמָּה לֹא שָׁמַרְתָּ, אֶל-אֲדֹנֶיךָ הַמֶּלֶךְ:  כִּי-בָא אַחַד הָעָם, לְהַשְׁחִית אֶת-הַמֶּלֶךְ אֲדֹנֶיךָ.
15.english: And David said to Abner: 'Art not thou a valiant man? and who is like to thee in Israel? wherefore then hast thou not kept watch over thy lord the king? for there came one of the people in to destroy the king thy lord.

16.hebrew: לֹא-טוֹב הַדָּבָר הַזֶּה, אֲשֶׁר עָשִׂיתָ--חַי-יְהוָה כִּי בְנֵי-מָוֶת אַתֶּם, אֲשֶׁר לֹא-שְׁמַרְתֶּם עַל-אֲדֹנֵיכֶם עַל-מְשִׁיחַ יְהוָה; וְעַתָּה רְאֵה, אֵי-חֲנִית הַמֶּלֶךְ וְאֶת-צַפַּחַת הַמַּיִם--אֲשֶׁר מְרַאֲשֹׁתָו.
16.english: This thing is not good that thou hast done. As the LORD liveth, ye deserve to die, because ye have not kept watch over your lord, the LORD'S anointed. And now, see, where the king's spear is, and the cruse of water that was at his head.'

17.hebrew: וַיַּכֵּר שָׁאוּל, אֶת-קוֹל דָּוִד, וַיֹּאמֶר, הֲקוֹלְךָ זֶה בְּנִי דָוִד; וַיֹּאמֶר דָּוִד, קוֹלִי אֲדֹנִי הַמֶּלֶךְ.
17.english: And Saul knew David's voice, and said: 'Is this thy voice, my son David?' And David said: 'It is my voice, my lord, O king.'

18.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר, לָמָּה זֶּה אֲדֹנִי רֹדֵף אַחֲרֵי עַבְדּוֹ:  כִּי מֶה עָשִׂיתִי, וּמַה-בְּיָדִי רָעָה.
18.english: And he said: 'Wherefore doth my lord pursue after his servant? for what have I done? or what evil is in my hand?

19.hebrew: וְעַתָּה, יִשְׁמַע-נָא אֲדֹנִי הַמֶּלֶךְ, אֵת, דִּבְרֵי עַבְדּוֹ:  אִם-יְהוָה הֱסִיתְךָ בִי, יָרַח מִנְחָה, וְאִם בְּנֵי הָאָדָם אֲרוּרִים הֵם לִפְנֵי יְהוָה, כִּי-גֵרְשׁוּנִי הַיּוֹם מֵהִסְתַּפֵּחַ בְּנַחֲלַת יְהוָה לֵאמֹר לֵךְ עֲבֹד אֱלֹהִים אֲחֵרִים.
19.english: Now therefore, I pray thee, let my lord the king hear the words of his servant. If it be the LORD that hath stirred thee up against me, let Him accept an offering; but if it be the children of men, cursed be they before the LORD; for they have driven me out this day that I should not cleave unto the inheritance of the LORD, saying: Go, serve other gods.

20.hebrew: וְעַתָּה, אַל-יִפֹּל דָּמִי אַרְצָה, מִנֶּגֶד, פְּנֵי יְהוָה:  כִּי-יָצָא מֶלֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵל, לְבַקֵּשׁ אֶת-פַּרְעֹשׁ אֶחָד, כַּאֲשֶׁר יִרְדֹּף הַקֹּרֵא, בֶּהָרִים.
20.english: Now therefore, let not my blood fall to the earth away from the presence of the LORD; for the king of Israel is come out to seek a single flea, as when one doth hunt a partridge in the mountains.'

21.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר שָׁאוּל חָטָאתִי שׁוּב בְּנִי-דָוִד, כִּי לֹא-אָרַע לְךָ עוֹד, תַּחַת אֲשֶׁר יָקְרָה נַפְשִׁי בְּעֵינֶיךָ, הַיּוֹם הַזֶּה:  הִנֵּה הִסְכַּלְתִּי וָאֶשְׁגֶּה, הַרְבֵּה מְאֹד.
21.english: Then said Saul: 'I have sinned; return, my son David; for I will no more do thee harm, because my life was precious in thine eyes this day; behold, I have played the fool and erred exceedingly.'

22.hebrew: וַיַּעַן דָּוִד וַיֹּאמֶר, הִנֵּה החנית (חֲנִית) הַמֶּלֶךְ; וְיַעֲבֹר אֶחָד מֵהַנְּעָרִים, וְיִקָּחֶהָ.
22.english: And David answered and said: 'Behold the king's spear! let then one of the young men come over and fetch it.

23.hebrew: וַיהוָה יָשִׁיב לָאִישׁ, אֶת-צִדְקָתוֹ וְאֶת-אֱמֻנָתוֹ--אֲשֶׁר נְתָנְךָ יְהוָה הַיּוֹם, בְּיָד, וְלֹא אָבִיתִי, לִשְׁלֹחַ יָדִי בִּמְשִׁיחַ יְהוָה.
23.english: And the LORD will render to every man his righteousness and his faithfulness; forasmuch as the LORD delivered thee into my hand to-day, and I would not put forth my hand against the LORD'S anointed.

24.hebrew: וְהִנֵּה, כַּאֲשֶׁר גָּדְלָה נַפְשְׁךָ הַיּוֹם הַזֶּה--בְּעֵינָי:  כֵּן תִּגְדַּל נַפְשִׁי בְּעֵינֵי יְהוָה, וְיַצִּלֵנִי מִכָּל-צָרָה.  {פ}
24.english: And, behold, as thy life was much set by this day in mine eyes, so let my life be much set by in the eyes of the LORD, and let Him deliver me out of all tribulation.' {P}

25.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר שָׁאוּל אֶל-דָּוִד, בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה בְּנִי דָוִד--גַּם עָשֹׂה תַעֲשֶׂה, וְגַם יָכֹל תּוּכָל; וַיֵּלֶךְ דָּוִד לְדַרְכּוֹ, וְשָׁאוּל שָׁב לִמְקוֹמוֹ.  {פ}
25.english: Then Saul said to David: 'Blessed be thou, my son David; thou shalt both do mightily, and shalt surely prevail.' So David went his way, and Saul returned to his place. {P}

1.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר דָּוִד אֶל-לִבּוֹ, עַתָּה אֶסָּפֶה יוֹם-אֶחָד בְּיַד-שָׁאוּל; אֵין-לִי טוֹב כִּי הִמָּלֵט אִמָּלֵט אֶל-אֶרֶץ פְּלִשְׁתִּים, וְנוֹאַשׁ מִמֶּנִּי שָׁאוּל לְבַקְשֵׁנִי עוֹד בְּכָל-גְּבוּל יִשְׂרָאֵל, וְנִמְלַטְתִּי, מִיָּדוֹ.
1.english: And David said in his heart: 'I shall now be swept away one day by the hand of Saul; there is nothing better for me than that I should escape into the land of the Philistines; and Saul will despair of me, to seek me any more in all the borders of Israel; so shall I escape out of his hand.'

2.hebrew: וַיָּקָם דָּוִד--וַיַּעֲבֹר הוּא, וְשֵׁשׁ-מֵאוֹת אִישׁ אֲשֶׁר עִמּוֹ:  אֶל-אָכִישׁ בֶּן-מָעוֹךְ, מֶלֶךְ גַּת.
2.english: And David arose, and passed over, he and the six hundred men that were with him, unto Achish the son of Maoch, king of Gath.

3.hebrew: וַיֵּשֶׁב דָּוִד עִם-אָכִישׁ בְּגַת הוּא וַאֲנָשָׁיו, אִישׁ וּבֵיתוֹ:  דָּוִד, וּשְׁתֵּי נָשָׁיו, אֲחִינֹעַם הַיִּזְרְעֵאלִת, וַאֲבִיגַיִל אֵשֶׁת-נָבָל הַכַּרְמְלִית.
3.english: And David dwelt with Achish at Gath, he and his men, every man with his household, even David with his two wives, Ahinoam the Jezreelitess, and Abigail the Carmelitess, Nabal's wife.

4.hebrew: וַיֻּגַּד לְשָׁאוּל, כִּי-בָרַח דָּוִד גַּת; וְלֹא-יוסף (יָסַף) עוֹד, לְבַקְשׁוֹ.  {ס}
4.english: And it was told Saul that David was fled to Gath; and he sought no more again for him. {S}

5.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר דָּוִד אֶל-אָכִישׁ, אִם-נָא מָצָאתִי חֵן בְּעֵינֶיךָ יִתְּנוּ-לִי מָקוֹם בְּאַחַת עָרֵי הַשָּׂדֶה--וְאֵשְׁבָה שָּׁם; וְלָמָּה יֵשֵׁב עַבְדְּךָ בְּעִיר הַמַּמְלָכָה, עִמָּךְ.
5.english: And David said unto Achish: 'If now I have found favour in thine eyes, let them give me a place in one of the cities in the country, that I may dwell there; for why should thy servant dwell in the royal city with thee?'

6.hebrew: וַיִּתֶּן-לוֹ אָכִישׁ בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא, אֶת-צִקְלָג; לָכֵן הָיְתָה צִקְלַג לְמַלְכֵי יְהוּדָה, עַד הַיּוֹם הַזֶּה.  {פ}
6.english: Then Achish gave him Ziklag that day; wherefore Ziklag belongeth unto the kings of Judah unto this day. {P}

7.hebrew: וַיְהִי מִסְפַּר הַיָּמִים, אֲשֶׁר-יָשַׁב דָּוִד בִּשְׂדֵה פְלִשְׁתִּים--יָמִים, וְאַרְבָּעָה חֳדָשִׁים.
7.english: And the number of the days that David dwelt in the country of the Philistines was a full year and four months.

8.hebrew: וַיַּעַל דָּוִד וַאֲנָשָׁיו, וַיִּפְשְׁטוּ אֶל-הַגְּשׁוּרִי והגרזי (וְהַגִּזְרִי) וְהָעֲמָלֵקִי:  כִּי הֵנָּה יֹשְׁבוֹת הָאָרֶץ, אֲשֶׁר מֵעוֹלָם, בּוֹאֲךָ שׁוּרָה, וְעַד-אֶרֶץ מִצְרָיִם.
8.english: And David and his men went up, and made a raid upon the Geshurites, and the Gizrites, and the Amalekites; for those were the inhabitants of the land, who were of old, as thou goest to Shur, even unto the land of Egypt.

9.hebrew: וְהִכָּה דָוִד אֶת-הָאָרֶץ, וְלֹא יְחַיֶּה אִישׁ וְאִשָּׁה; וְלָקַח צֹאן וּבָקָר וַחֲמֹרִים וּגְמַלִּים, וּבְגָדִים, וַיָּשָׁב, וַיָּבֹא אֶל-אָכִישׁ.
9.english: And David smote the land, and left neither man nor woman alive, and took away the sheep, and the oxen, and the asses, and the camels, and the apparel. And he returned, and came to Achish.

10.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר אָכִישׁ, אַל-פְּשַׁטְתֶּם הַיּוֹם; וַיֹּאמֶר דָּוִד, עַל-נֶגֶב יְהוּדָה וְעַל-נֶגֶב הַיְּרַחְמְאֵלִי, וְאֶל-נֶגֶב, הַקֵּינִי.
10.english: And Achish said: 'Whither have ye made a raid to-day?' And David said: 'Against the South of Judah, and against the South of the Jerahmeelites, and against the South of the Kenites.'

11.hebrew: וְאִישׁ וְאִשָּׁה לֹא-יְחַיֶּה דָוִד, לְהָבִיא גַת לֵאמֹר--פֶּן-יַגִּדוּ עָלֵינוּ, לֵאמֹר:  כֹּה-עָשָׂה דָוִד, וְכֹה מִשְׁפָּטוֹ, כָּל-הַיָּמִים, אֲשֶׁר יָשַׁב בִּשְׂדֵה פְלִשְׁתִּים.
11.english: And David left neither man nor woman alive, to bring them to Gath, saying: 'Lest they should tell on us, saying: So did David, and so hath been his manner all the while he hath dwelt in the country of the Philistines.'

12.hebrew: וַיַּאֲמֵן אָכִישׁ, בְּדָוִד לֵאמֹר:  הַבְאֵשׁ הִבְאִישׁ בְּעַמּוֹ בְיִשְׂרָאֵל, וְהָיָה לִי לְעֶבֶד עוֹלָם.  {פ}
12.english: And Achish believed David, saying: 'He hath made his people Israel utterly to abhor him; therefore he shall be my servant for ever.' {P}

1.english: And it came to pass in those days, that the Philistines gathered their hosts together for warfare, to fight with Israel. And Achish said unto David: 'Know thou assuredly, that thou shalt go out with me in the host, thou and thy men.'

12.english: And when the woman saw Samuel, she cried with a loud voice; and the woman spoke to Saul, saying: 'Why hast thou deceived me? for thou art Saul.'

13.english: And the king said unto her: 'Be not afraid; for what seest thou?' And the woman said unto Saul: 'I see a godlike being coming up out of the earth.'

14.english: And he said unto her: 'What form is he of?' And she said: 'An old man cometh up; and he is covered with a robe.' And Saul perceived that it was Samuel, and he bowed with his face to the ground, and prostrated himself. {S}

15.english: And Samuel said to Saul: 'Why hast thou disquieted me, to bring me up?' And Saul answered: 'I am sore distressed; for the Philistines make war against me, and God is departed from me, and answereth me no more, neither by prophets, nor by dreams; therefore I have called thee, that thou mayest make known unto me what I shall do.' {S}

17.english: And the LORD hath wrought for Himself; as He spoke by me; and the LORD hath rent the kingdom out of thy hand, and given it to thy neighbour, even to David.

18.english: Because thou didst not hearken to the voice of the LORD, and didst not execute His fierce wrath upon Amalek, therefore hath the LORD done this thing unto thee this day.

19.english: Moreover the LORD will deliver Israel also with thee into the hand of the Philistines; and to-morrow shalt thou and thy sons be with me; the LORD will deliver the host of Israel also into the hand of the Philistines.'

20.english: Then Saul fell straightway his full length upon the earth, and was sore afraid, because of the words of Samuel; and there was no strength in him; for he had eaten no bread all the day, nor all the night.

21.english: And the woman came unto Saul, and saw that he was sore affrighted, and said unto him: 'Behold, thy handmaid hath hearkened unto thy voice, and I have put my life in my hand, and have hearkened unto thy words which thou spokest unto me.

22.english: Now therefore, I pray thee, hearken thou also unto the voice of thy handmaid, and let me set a morsel of bread before thee; and eat, that thou mayest have strength, when thou goest on thy way.'

23.english: But he refused, and said: 'I will not eat.' But his servants, together with the woman, urged him; and he hearkened unto their voice. So he arose from the earth, and sat upon the bed.

24.english: And the woman had a fatted calf in the house; and she made haste, and killed it; and she took flour, and kneaded it, and did bake unleavened bread thereof;
